past simple and past participle of
cajole
to persuade someone to do something they might not want to do, by pleasant talk and (sometimes false) promises: He really knows how to cajole people into doing what he wants. I managed to cajole her out of leaving too early. The most effective technique is to cajole rather than to threaten. Synonyms
coax
inveigle formal
wheedle disapproving
